title: Super Version 4.0.3 (com.macjutsu.super)
description: Preference settings for S.U.P.E.R.M.A.N. update script. Full details on these settings can be found in the wiki: https://github.com/Macjutsu/super/wiki.

DeferralTimerDefault.title: Deferral Timer Default
DeferralTimerDefault.description: The number of minutes to defer until the next update workflow attempt if a user choses not restart. Put X to disable.

DeferralTimerMenu.title: Deferral Timer Menu
DeferralTimerMenu.description: Display a deferral time pop-up menu in the non-deadline restart dialog that allows the user to override the --deferral-timer-default timer. Put X to disable.

DeferralTimerFocus.title: Deferral Timer Focus
DeferralTimerFocus.description: The number of minutes to defer automatically if the user has enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep (for example, during an active meeting). Put X to disable.

DeferralTimerError.title: Deferral Timer Error
DeferralTimerError.description: The number of minutes to defer if super detects an error in the workflow.  Times less than 2 minutes or more than 10080 minutes are rounded accordingly. Put X to disable.

DeferralTimerWorkflowRelaunch.title: Deferral Timer Workflow Relaunch
DeferralTimerWorkflowRelaunch.description: The number of minutes to defer if no software updates are available or allowed. Enabling this option results in super acting as a permanent agent that checks for software updates on a regular basis. Put X to disable.

DeadlineCountFocus.title: Deadline Count Focus
DeadlineCountFocus.description: The maximum number of automatic deferrals allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep (for example, during an active meeting). Put X to disable.

DeadlineCountSoft.title: Deadline Count Soft
DeadlineCountSoft.description: The maximum number of user selected deferrals allowed before showing a soft deadline dialog. A soft deadline displays an interactive update restart dialog indicating that no more deferrals are allowed. Put X to disable.

DeadlineCountHard.title: Deadline Count Hard
DeadlineCountHard.description: The maximum number of user selected deferrals allowed before the computer automatically restarts for updates without asking the user for approval. Put X to disable.

DeadlineDaysFocus.title: Deadline Days Focus
DeadlineDaysFocus.description: The maximum number of days that automatic deferrals are allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep (for example, during an active meeting). Put X to disable.

DeadlineDaysSoft.title: Deadline Days Soft
DeadlineDaysSoft.description: The maximum number of deferral days allowed before showing a soft deadline dialog. A soft deadline displays an interactive update restart dialog indicating that no more deferrals are allowed. Put X to disable.

DeadlineDaysHard.title: Deadline Days Hard
DeadlineDaysHard.description: The maximum number of days allowed before before the computer automatically restarts for updates without asking the user for approval. Put X to disable.

DeadlineDateFocus.title: Deadline Date Focus
DeadlineDateFocus.description: The last date and time when automatic deferrals are allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep (for example, during an active meeting). Put X to disable.

DeadlineDateSoft.title: Deadline Date Soft
DeadlineDateSoft.description: The last date and time before showing a soft deadline dialog. A soft deadline displays an interactive update restart dialog indicating that no more deferrals are allowed. Put X to disable.

DeadlineDateHard.title: Deadline Date Hard
DeadlineDateHard.description: If this date and time have passed the computer automatically restarts for updates without asking the user for approval. Put X to disable.

DialogTimeoutDefault.title: Dialog Timeout Default
DialogTimeoutDefault.description: Sets an automatic timeout for all interactive dialogs in seconds.  Timeouts less than 60 seconds or more than 86400 seconds (1 day) are rounded accordingly. Put X to disable.

DialogTimeoutRestartOrDefer.title: Dialog Timeout Restart Or Defer
DialogTimeoutRestartOrDefer.description: Sets an automatic timeout for the restart or defer dialog in seconds.  Timeouts less than 60 seconds or more than 86400 seconds (1 day) are rounded accordingly. Put X to disable.

DialogTimeoutSoftDeadline.title: Dialog Timeout Soft Deadline
DialogTimeoutSoftDeadline.description: Sets an automatic timeout for the soft deadline restart dialog in seconds. Put X to disable.

DialogTimeoutUserAuth.title: Dialog Timeout User Auth
DialogTimeoutUserAuth.description: On Mac computers with Apple Silicon, the number of seconds to wait for the user to successfully authenticate when presented with the user authentication dialog. Put X to disable.

DisplayUnmovable.title: Display Unmovable
DisplayUnmovable.description: Disable the user's ability to move super dialogs and notifications. Put X to disable.

DisplayHideBackground.title: Display Hide Background
DisplayHideBackground.description: Hide the background while displaying super dialogs and notifications. Put X to disable.

DisplaySilently.title: Display Silently
DisplaySilently.description: When enabled, the system alert sound is suppressed when displaying dialogs. Put X to disable.

DisplayNotificationsCentered.title: Display Notifications Centered
DisplayNotificationsCentered.description: Display super notifications in the center of the screen. Put X to disable.

DisplayIconFile.title: Display Icon File
DisplayIconFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to an image file to replace the default System Settings (or System Preferences) icon in super dialogs and notifications. Put X to disable.

DisplayIconSize.title: Display Icon Size
DisplayIconSize.description: Size in number of pixels for the icon in super dialogs and notifications. Put X to disable.

DisplayAccessoryType.title: Display Accessory Type
DisplayAccessoryType.description: Defines the file type of the display accessory content. Put X to disable.

DisplayAccessoryDefaultFile.title: Display Accessory Default File
DisplayAccessoryDefaultFile.description: Specifies a local path or web URL to a file with the content to be shown in dialogs unless otherwise specified by another option. Put X to disable.

DisplayAccessoryUpdateFile.title: Display Accessory Update File
DisplayAccessoryUpdateFile.description: Specifies a local path or web URL to a file with the content to be shown in dialogs only when performing macOS updates. Put X to disable.

DisplayAccessoryUpgradeFile.title: Display Accessory Upgrade File
DisplayAccessoryUpgradeFile.description: Specifies a local path or web URL to a file with the content to be shown in dialogs only when performing macOS upgrades. Put X to disable.

DisplayAccessoryUserAuthFile.title: Display Accessory User Auth File
DisplayAccessoryUserAuthFile.description: Specifies a local path or web URL to a file with the content to be shown in dialogs only when showing the Apple silicon user authentication dialog. Put X to disable.

DisplayHelpButtonString.title: Display Help Button String
DisplayHelpButtonString.description: A plain text string or URL to open when the user clicks the help button (question mark icon) in all interactive dialogs (but not notifications). Put X to disable.

DisplayWarningButtonString.title: Display Warning Button String
DisplayWarningButtonString.description: A plain text string or URL to open when the user clicks the warning button (exclamation mark icon) in all interactive dialogs (but not notifications). Put X to disable.

AuthAskUserToSavePassword.title: Auth Ask User To Save Password
AuthAskUserToSavePassword.description: Prompt the end user to save their password which can then be used to authenticate the local softwareupdate command.

AuthCredentialFailoverToUser.title: Auth Credential Failover To User
AuthCredentialFailoverToUser.description: If any managed automatic authentication method fails validation, then failover to local end user authentication

AuthJamfComputerID.title: Auth Jamf Computer ID
AuthJamfComputerID.description: In order to send a managed software update request, super must know the Jamf Pro ID of the computer's inventory record.

AuthJamfCustomURL.title: Auth Jamf Custom URL
AuthJamfCustomURL.description: Set a specific custom Jamf Pro URL for API calls.  Put X to disable.

AuthMDMFailoverToUser.title: User Authentication MDM Failover
AuthMDMFailoverToUser.description: If the MDM workflow fails, the default behavior of super is to automatically try again later based on the error deferral timer. This option accepts one or more MDM failover types that are comma separated with no spaces. Put X to disable.

TestStorageUpdate.title: Test Storage Update
TestStorageUpdate.description: Override the default automatically calculated free storage space requirements for updates. Put X to disable.

TestStorageUpgrade.title: Test Storage Upgrade
TestStorageUpgrade.description: Override the default automatically calculated free storage space requirements for upgrades. Put X to disable.

DialogTimeoutInsufficientStorage.title: Dialog Timeout Insufficient Storage
DialogTimeoutInsufficientStorage.description: Sets an automatic timeout for the insufficient storage dialog in seconds. Put X to disable.

TestBatteryLevel.title: Test Battery Level
TestBatteryLevel.description: Override the default battery level percentage (20% for Apple silicon, 50% for Intel) requirement. Put X to disable.

DialogTimeoutPowerRequired.title: Dialog Timeout Power Required
DialogTimeoutPowerRequired.description: Sets an automatic timeout for the power required dialog in seconds. Put X to disable.

InstallMacOSMajorUpgrades.title: Install MacOS Major Upgrades
InstallMacOSMajorUpgrades.description: macOS now presents some Upgrades options as updates, super detects and ignores them by default (objective update over upgrade). Enabling this setting will allow the upgrades.

InstallMacOSMajorVersionTarget.title: Install MacOS Major Version Target
InstallMacOSMajorVersionTarget.description: This setting provides a limitation on the Allow Upgrades setting, providing some management of the maximum macOS version to upgrade to. Put X to disable.

InstallRapidSecurityResponses.title: Install Rapid Security Responses
InstallRapidSecurityResponses.description: macOS 13.3+ Ventura support Rapid Security Response updates, which super will ignore if this is not enabled. super will ignore this setting on older macOS versions.

InstallNonSystemUpdatesWithoutRestarting.title: Install Non-System Updates Without Restarting
InstallNonSystemUpdatesWithoutRestarting.description: If you don't want the super workflow to wait for a macOS update to also install non-system Apple software updates, then you can enforce those non-system updates as soon as they become available.

WorkflowOnlyDownload.title: Workflow Only Download
WorkflowOnlyDownload.description: Download and prepare any available macOS updates but do not start any installation workflow. This super option is designed to work along with the --install-now option to significantly reduce the user experience wait time for user-initiated macOS update workflows.

WorkflowZeroDateManual.title: Workflow Zero Date Manual
WorkflowZeroDateManual.description: Instead of having super automatically select the beginning date and time of the super workflow (aka. day zero), this option sets a specific date and time as day zero. Put X to disable.

WorkflowDisableUpdateCheck.title: Workflow Disable Update Check
WorkflowDisableUpdateCheck.description: Skip Apple software updates, even if they are available.

WorkflowDisableRelaunch.title: Workflow Disable Relaunch
WorkflowDisableRelaunch.description: Disable the automatic relaunch of the super workflow when no macOS updates or upgrades are available and/or allowed.

WorkflowJamfPolicyTriggers.title: Workflow Jamf Policy Triggers
WorkflowJamfPolicyTriggers.description: Make the super workflow run one or more Jamf Pro Policy Triggers that are comma separated with no spaces. Put X to disable.

WorkflowRestartWithoutUpdates.title: Workflow Restart Without Updates
WorkflowRestartWithoutUpdates.description: Force a restart even if Apple software updates do not need it.

TestMode.title: Test Mode
TestMode.description: Mode to validate parameters, credentials, notifications, dialogs, deferrals, and deadline logic.

TestModeTimeout.title: Test Mode Timeout
TestModeTimeout.description: The amount of time in seconds to leave test notifications and dialogs open before moving on in the workflow. Put X to disable.

VerboseMode.title: Verbose Mode
VerboseMode.description: Mode to generate additional log output.
